oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Panamanian polychromatic ceramic vessel
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian pottery with a polychromatic design, including black, white, red, and purple pigments. This motif includes horizontal bands of varying thickness and color, and a single band of repeated crossed lines or X shapes around the vessel shoulder. The rim is restrictive and everted, flaring out at the neck.
Fractures radiate outward from a break in the base that has been reassembled and glued. Rim is broken in two places.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
